title: Director of Investments Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: One zoom video interview. The interview took perhaps 15-20 min. No response after sending personal thank you messages. Slightly unprofessional and rather judgmental. Very "knit-picky" of resume for having editing errors within the endowments annual report.
Interview Questions:
How did you get that job? (referring to a very prestigious previous role)

Where is your undergraduate degree on your resume? (while holding an MBA)

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: I had several interviews leading up to my position. The hiring process was communicated efficiently with me, they were transparent about other candidates. My interviews included both technical and personal questions.
Interview Questions: What job responsibilities and experiences I had previously.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over Zoom (pre-Covid). They asked questions related to the job and nothing too complicated or philosophical. They were friendly and sent a follow up email (they did not ghost me).

title: LRC Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and painless! Jean was very sweet and I felt very comfortable in the interview.  The questions were what you would expect and I didn't feel tripped up.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: It was a full day process, with meeting 1 on 1 with all the faculty in the department including my prospective boss, lunch with current students, and a job talk aimed at an undergraduate audience.
Interview Questions: My prospective boss asked my thoughts on troubleshooting a particular odd behavior of some of the equipment in their lab.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: It was very good and positive. I got the job immediately afterward. The employer was nice and easy. I didn't need to stress much.  We went through the job obligations and he asked me about my experience.

title: Housekeeping Hall Work Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College (South Hadley, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer will just ask you about how your schedule looks like and why you want to do the job. I basically answered that it seems like a great job to have because it easily fits into your class schedule.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College (South Hadley, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: For the application, I submitted the resume and cover letter. Then the manager emailed me to set up an in-person interview at office, going over her expectations and responsibilities. I got the job and it was great working with the whole office.
Interview Questions:
What are your greatest weaknesses and strengths?
Why do you think you fit this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: it is a standard application on Jobx, the college's student employment website and then a follow-up interview and then email response, it is pretty standard although sometimes each department does not get back to you
Interview Questions: Interview questions depended on the type of job you apply for

title: ELA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College (South Hadley, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward. The interviewer was very nice. The questions were not tricky and nothing out of the ordinary. Mount Holyoke has such a beautiful campus and it helped me calm down. The office is located right by the lake and the people were very nice.

title: Peer Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College
Interview Descriptions: It took me about 2 weeks. I applied online and was invited for an interview with multiple people from the office. IT was a fair interview process as the questions were clear and very genuine.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why do you want to be a Peer Career Advisor.

title: CIO Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: They used a search committee for most of the screening; the search committee reviewed only resumes and cover letters to select candidates airport interviews. I believe they brought 3 candidates for on campus interviews.
Interview Questions: What attracts you to this position?

title: Peer Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mount Holyoke College in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: You can find the job postings online on the school job search database. They will usually contact you in about a week and  have an interview with you. The interviews are usually very short and sweet with direct questions. Just need to learn to think on your feet and be genuine.
Interview Questions: How will you approach students who are older than you?
